info.description: APIs to create and manage consents : Account Consent (AISP consent resource at the ASPSP, defining access rights to dedicated accounts of a given PSU-ID) and Confirmation of Funds Consent (CBPII consent resource at the ASPSP regarding confirmation of funds access to a specific account)
info.title: PSD II Consent management services

post.description: This API is to record a Customer's Consent to the Account Information Service of the TPP. This also records the account references for which the consent is provided, any accounts that are blocked and the period of blocking, the type of consent, expiry date and the status of the consent and the last modified date.   The API shall be linked to  the 'create consent' published API in accordance with the Open Banking norms to record Account Consent details.

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

put.summary: Records Customer Account Consent after successful Strong Customer Authentication
put.description: API to record consent creation of a user/customer to share his/her account information after successful Strong Customer Authentication and used to set customer context in consent.

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: deviceId

parameters.name: userRole

get.summary: Returns Customer Account Consent record details
get.description: API to return the list of Accounts and the details for which Consent is given provided the Consent reference is queried. Unauthorised Consents are also included in the search.  The information on the Accounts include:  1. The Validity of the Consent, Access Frequency, Recurring Indicator and its current Status including the last modified date  2. The Account Consent data including the Consent Type, the Account references, the respective Category and Currency and the Avaialable Balance for each of the Account consented by the Customer  The API shall be linked to the 'get consent request' published API in accordance with the Open Banking norms to get Account Consent details.

parameters.name: consentId
parameters.description: Identifier of the corresponding consent object as retrieved by an account Information consent Request.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

put.description: API to allow a User/Customer to Withdraw the Consent provided earlier to the sharing of his/her Account information.   The API shall be linked to  the 'withdrawConsent' published API in accordance with the Open Banking norms to approve a received Consent.

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

get.summary: Returns Status of the customer Account Consent.
get.description: API to retrieve the Status of the Consent provided by a Customer when the Consent Reference ID is queried.  The different statuses reported are Consent Received (in case of unauthorised), Expired, Terminated by TPP and Revoked by PSU.  The API shall be linked to  the 'get consent status request' published API in accordance with the Open Banking norms to get Account Consent Status

parameters.name: consentId
parameters.description: Identifier of the corresponding consent object as retrieved by an account Information consent Request.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

get.summary: Retrieves the consent information and status of TPP
get.description: API to retrieve Account Consent information in detail provided the customer ID, the Consent Status, Consent ID are provided.  The detailed informantion includes:  1. The Third Party Provider Reference  Name and Status 2. The signed up service  3. The Expiry Date of the Consent and its current Status including the last modified date  4. The Account Consent data including the Consent Type, the Account references, the Short Titles, the respective Category and whether or not the account consent is blocked and if blocked the start and the end date information for each of the Account consented by the Customer.

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Identifier of the customer

parameters.name: consentStatus
parameters.description: Status of the consent. This can be of received, valid, expired, terminatedByTpp or revokedByPsu.

get.description: API to retrieve the list of AA Products considered as Payment Accounts and therefore eligible for PSD2 based on the Product configuration defined within the parameters. Any products not meeting the criteria defined within the parameters will not be included within this list.

parameters.description: Indicates the product definition (PZ/PX)

code.description: The code related to override message.

responseCode.description: The user input to accept/reject the override.

arrangement.description: Unique identifier for the arrangement contract

customer.description: Contains the customer identifier to fetch list of consent arrangements for the customer or customer identifier of the debtor account. This will be populated once the SCA(Strong Customer Authentication) is completed.

product.description: Indicates an id or name of a product

arrangementEffectiveDate.description: It is a date on/upon which an account is considered to take effect

activity.description: Defines the activity to be processed against the Arrangement. The activity may be a user activity or a system generated activity.

reason.description: Contains the reason for performing the current activity

consentTypes.description: Consent Type for which the consent is given

consentType.description: Consent Type for which the consent is given

accountIBANs.description: Indicates the consent sub type linked to corresponding consent type.

accountIBAN.description: Represents the International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the account.  E.g. GB29 NWBK 6016 1331 9268 19

isConsentGiven.description: Indicates whether the consent is given for a specific type. Allowed values:  - YES,NO

accountBlock.description: Indicates whether the consent account has been blocked or not. Holds YES/NO/Blank.

blockFrom.description: Specifies the date on which account consent is blocked.

blockTill.description: Specifies until which date account consent to be blocked.

blockNotes.description: Indicates the reason for which the consent is blocked.

consentSubType.description: Indicates the consent sub type linked to corresponding consent type.

consentStatuses.description: Status of the consent. This can be of received, valid, expired, terminatedByTpp or revokedByPsu.

consentStatus.description: Status of the consent. This can be of received, valid, expired, terminatedByTpp or revokedByPsu.

lastActionDate.description: Indicates the date on which the status of the consent arrangement changed.

thirdpartyproviderId.description: Unique TPP(third party provider) reference which is the global urn of the TPP. For example: PSDLU-CSSF-9db9074bf3be45550237a21cd2a11585

signUpService.description: Indicates whether the signing up information is to be AISP(Accounts information service provider) or PISP(Payments information service provider).

recurringIndicator.description: Indicates whether the expiry date to be recalculated for every duration of expiry period.

frequencyPerDay.description: Specifies the frequency in which the payment application executes the payment instruction

combinedServiceIndicator.description: Specifies whether the payment initiation service will be addressed in the same session as account information consent request

scaStatus.description: Contains the status of the strong customer authentication process for the payment or consent. Valid values are received, psuIdentified, scaMethodSelected, started, finalised or failed

link.description: Contains the arrangement activity reference of the parent. This is used during secondary activity processing where child activities are generated at runtime during processing.

thirdpartyprovider.description: Contains the TPP (third party provider) name or text of the TPP reference

externalUserId.description: Contains the external user identifier for which the consent is created.

onlineArrangement.description: Contains the arrangement identifier of the external user that contains the rights that the external user has access to.

cardNumber.description: Cards issued are defined with an identifier consisting of three elements. The card type, a full stop and the card number. The card number may be any alphanumeric construction, commonly a 16 numeric number is used. VISA.5332870296579001. The id must be in the form of:  CCCC.AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA  Where CCCC is the card type and AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA is a unique identifier.  Examples:   VISA.1234567887654321   GC.1111222233334444   AB21.1111111122222222

expiryDate.description: The date an agreement such as an arrangement, product, credit facility or limit is due to expire

cardType.description: The type of the card, e.g. Visa, Mastercard, etc.

additionalInformation.description: Additional Information provided to add context

aaaId.description: The Identifier of the aa record created

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique identifier/Message Reference of the record created.

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

accountId.description: Identifier of the account. Often referred to as the account number, yet for consistency this is always referred to as accountId. Accepts both IBAN & BBAN

accountName.description: Display name or short name of the account specified.

recurringIndicator.description: Indicates whether the expiry date to be recalculated for every duration of expiry period.

frequencyPerDay.description: Specifies the frequency in which the payment application executes the payment instruction

arrangementId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

category.description: Indicates the account or contract product name. For example for an account this maybe current, savings etc.

productDescription.description: Indicates the description of the Product

availableBalance.description: Available balance of the account which is the projected balance which includes the net movements of both debits and credits against the account.

sortCode.description: Contains bank sort code or iban branch identifier for the account

IBAN.description: International Bank Account number, an identifier of the account. E.g. GB29 NWBK 6016 1331 9268 19

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

cardNumber.description: Cards issued are defined with an identifier consisting of three elements. The card type, a full stop and the card number. The card number may be any alphanumeric construction, commonly a 16 numeric number is used. VISA.5332870296579001. The id must be in the form of:  CCCC.AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA  Where CCCC is the card type and AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA is a unique identifier.  Examples:   VISA.1234567887654321   GC.1111222233334444   AB21.1111111122222222

expiryDate.description: The date an agreement such as an arrangement, product, credit facility or limit is due to expire

cardType.description: The type of the card, e.g. Visa, Mastercard, etc.

additionalInformation.description: Additional Information provided to add context

combinedServiceIndicator.description: Specifies whether the payment initiation service will be addressed in the same session as account information consent request

signUpService.description: Indicates whether the signing up information is to be AISP(Accounts information service provider) or PISP(Payments information service provider).

thirdpartyproviderId.description: Unique TPP(third party provider) reference which is the global urn of the TPP. For example: PSDLU-CSSF-9db9074bf3be45550237a21cd2a11585

accountIBANs.description: Consent Type for which the consent is given

accountIBAN.description: Represents the International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the account.  E.g. GB29 NWBK 6016 1331 9268 19

isConsentGiven.description: Indicates whether the consent is given for a specific type. Allowed values:  - YES,NO

accountBlock.description: Indicates whether the consent account has been blocked or not. Holds YES/NO/Blank.

blockFrom.description: Specifies the date on which account consent is blocked.

blockTill.description: Specifies until which date account consent to be blocked.

blockNotes.description: Indicates the reason for which the consent is blocked.

categoryId.description: Unique identifier associated with the product name of the account or contract. For example: For customer/counterparty accounts, the identifier would be in the range 1000 to 9999. For ledger accounts, in the range 10000 to 19999.

shortName.description: Contains the name of the account, basically the short title of the account.

consentType.description: Consent Type for which the consent is given

consentId.description: Identifier of the corresponding consent object as retrieved by an account Information consent Request.

thirdpartyproviderId.description: Unique TPP(third party provider) reference which is the global urn of the TPP. For example: PSDLU-CSSF-9db9074bf3be45550237a21cd2a11585

thirdpartyprovider.description: Contains the TPP (third party provider) name or text of the TPP reference

tppStatus.description: Contains the status of the open banking directory created for consent. This is used for blocked consents. If the TPP (third party provider) is blocked based on open banking directory, this will contain 'BLOCKED', else null

signUpService.description: Indicates whether the signing up information is to be AISP(Accounts information service provider) or PISP(Payments information service provider).

recurringIndicator.description: Indicates whether the expiry date to be recalculated for every duration of expiry period.

consentStatus.description: Status of the consent. This can be of received, valid, expired, terminatedByTpp or revokedByPsu.

lastActionDate.description: Indicates the date on which the status of the consent arrangement changed.

arrangementStatus.description: Status of the arrangement. E.g. AUTH, CLOSE, UNAUTH etc.

arrangementId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

imagePath.description: Identifies the image stored on the file system, specifically based on the logo url mentioned in open banking directory.

cardNumber.description: Cards issued are defined with an identifier consisting of three elements. The card type, a full stop and the card number. The card number may be any alphanumeric construction, commonly a 16 numeric number is used. VISA.5332870296579001. The id must be in the form of:  CCCC.AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA  Where CCCC is the card type and AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA is a unique identifier.  Examples:   VISA.1234567887654321   GC.1111222233334444   AB21.1111111122222222

expiryDate.description: The date an agreement such as an arrangement, product, credit facility or limit is due to expire

cardType.description: The type of the card, e.g. Visa, Mastercard, etc.

additionalInformation.description: Additional Information provided to add context

arrangement.description: Unique identifier for the arrangement contract

customer.description: Contains the customer identifier to fetch list of consent arrangements for the customer or customer identifier of the debtor account. This will be populated once the SCA(Strong Customer Authentication) is completed.

product.description: Indicates an id or name of a product

arrangementEffectiveDate.description: It is a date on/upon which an account is considered to take effect

activity.description: Defines the activity to be processed against the Arrangement. The activity may be a user activity or a system generated activity.

reason.description: Contains the reason for performing the current activity

consentTypes.description: Consent Type for which the consent is given

consentType.description: Consent Type for which the consent is given

accountIBANs.description: Indicates the consent sub type linked to corresponding consent type.

accountIBAN.description: Represents the International Bank Account Number (IBAN) of the account.  E.g. GB29 NWBK 6016 1331 9268 19

isConsentGiven.description: Indicates whether the consent is given for a specific type. Allowed values:  - YES,NO

accountBlock.description: Indicates whether the consent account has been blocked or not. Holds YES/NO/Blank.

blockFrom.description: Specifies the date on which account consent is blocked.

blockTill.description: Specifies until which date account consent to be blocked.

blockNotes.description: Indicates the reason for which the consent is blocked.

consentSubType.description: Indicates the consent sub type linked to corresponding consent type.

consentStatuses.description: Status of the consent. This can be of received, valid, expired, terminatedByTpp or revokedByPsu.

consentStatus.description: Status of the consent. This can be of received, valid, expired, terminatedByTpp or revokedByPsu.

lastActionDate.description: Indicates the date on which the status of the consent arrangement changed.

thirdpartyproviderId.description: Unique TPP(third party provider) reference which is the global urn of the TPP. For example: PSDLU-CSSF-9db9074bf3be45550237a21cd2a11585

signUpService.description: Indicates whether the signing up information is to be AISP(Accounts information service provider) or PISP(Payments information service provider).

recurringIndicator.description: Indicates whether the expiry date to be recalculated for every duration of expiry period.

frequencyPerDay.description: Specifies the frequency in which the payment application executes the payment instruction

combinedServiceIndicator.description: Specifies whether the payment initiation service will be addressed in the same session as account information consent request

scaStatus.description: Contains the status of the strong customer authentication process for the payment or consent. Valid values are received, psuIdentified, scaMethodSelected, started, finalised or failed

link.description: Contains the arrangement activity reference of the parent. This is used during secondary activity processing where child activities are generated at runtime during processing.

thirdpartyprovider.description: Contains the TPP (third party provider) name or text of the TPP reference

externalUserId.description: Contains the external user identifier for which the consent is created.

onlineArrangement.description: Contains the arrangement identifier of the external user that contains the rights that the external user has access to.

cardNumber.description: Cards issued are defined with an identifier consisting of three elements. The card type, a full stop and the card number. The card number may be any alphanumeric construction, commonly a 16 numeric number is used. VISA.5332870296579001. The id must be in the form of:  CCCC.AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA  Where CCCC is the card type and AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA is a unique identifier.  Examples:   VISA.1234567887654321   GC.1111222233334444   AB21.1111111122222222

activity.description: Defines the activity to be processed against the Arrangement. The activity may be a user activity or a system generated activity.

reason.description: Contains the reason for performing the current activity

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

id.description: The Identifier of the record created

link.description: Contains the arrangement activity reference of the parent. This is used during secondary activity processing where child activities are generated at runtime during processing.

The id must be in the form of:  CCCC.AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA  Where CCCC is the card type and AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA is a unique identifier.  Examples:   VISA.1234567887654321   GC.1111222233334444   AB21.1111111122222222

expiryDate.description: The date an agreement such as an arrangement, product, credit facility or limit is due to expire

cardType.description: The type of the card, e.g. Visa, Mastercard, etc.

additionalInformation.description: Additional Information provided to add context

psd2Eligible.description: Indicates whether the input accounts are PSD2 eligible or not

errorAccount.description: Contains the account that can be used instead of the account which is specified to receive credit/debit in case there is problem during payment process.

productGroups.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

productGroup.description: Indicates a group under which the products exists

product.description: Indicates an id or name of a product

productDescription.description: Indicates the description of the Product

productLine.description: The top level product line, which the product is ultimately attached to. May be a Temenos-defined product line such as ACCOUNTS, AGENT, BUNDLE, CONSENT, DEPOSITS, LENDING, REWARDS, etc. or one defined by the institution to manage external products.
